title: Configure the bastion node
content:
You must install Docker on the bastion node so that you can run the scripts to download and upload container images to your external registry (see Download and upload container images to an external registry).  

Note The following steps give example commands, which you may need to adjust according to the operating system version of your bastion node. 
  1. Run the following commands to install Docker.
    • To install Docker on Ubuntu, run these commands: 
      sudo apt update
sudo apt install docker.io
    • To install Docker on Red Hat Enterprise Linux or CentOS Linux, run these commands: 
      sudo yum install -y yum-utils
sudo yum-config-manager --add-repo https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/docker-ce.repo
sudo yum install -y docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
  2. Enable Docker and empower to run Docker commands as non-root. 
    sudo groupadd docker
sudo usermod -a -G docker ${USER}
sudo systemctl start docker
sudo systemctl enable docker
  3. Log out and log in again to the bastion to enable the Docker group.
